metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000421 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Gifsicle gifview 1.89 and older is vulnerable to a use-after-free in the read_gif function resulting potential code execution It was discovered that Gifsicle did not properly handle certain input. If a user were tricked into opening a malicious GIF, an attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gifsicle - 1.88-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gifsicle package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.88-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
